com.communote.server.api.core.task

Interface TaskManagement

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TaskManagementImpl

    public interface TaskManagement
    Service for managing tasks. If Communote is clustered there will be more than one instance on which a task can be executed. The different instances or nodes are identified by their name as defined in the StartupProperties.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

    • Method Detail

      • addTask

        Long addTask(String uniqueTaskName,
             boolean active,
             Long interval,
             Date nextExecutionDate,
             Class<? extends TaskHandler> handlerClass)
      throws TaskAlreadyExistsException
        Add a new task.
        Parameters:
        uniqueTaskName - Unique name for this task.
        active - True, if active.
        interval - Interval for the execution.
        nextExecutionDate - The next execution date.
        handlerClass - Class of the handler.
        Returns:
        The id of the Task.
        Throws:
        TaskAlreadyExistsException - Thrown, when there is already a task with this name.

      • addTask

        Long addTask(String uniqueTaskName,
             boolean active,
             Long interval,
             Date nextExecutionDate,
             Map<String,String> properties,
             Class<? extends TaskHandler> handlerClass)
      throws TaskAlreadyExistsException
        Add a new task.
        Parameters:
        uniqueTaskName - Unique name for this task.
        active - True, if active.
        interval - Interval for the execution.
        nextExecutionDate - The next execution date.
        properties - Properties of this task.
        handlerClass - Class of the handler.
        Returns:
        The id of the Task.
        Throws:
        TaskAlreadyExistsException - Thrown, when there is already a task with this name.

      • addTask

        Long addTask(String uniqueTaskName,
             boolean active,
             Long interval,
             Date nextExecutionDate,
             Map<String,String> properties,
             String handlerClass)
      throws TaskAlreadyExistsException
        Add a new task.
        Parameters:
        uniqueTaskName - Unique name for this task.
        active - True, if active.
        interval - Interval for the execution.
        nextExecutionDate - The next execution date.
        properties - Properties of this task.
        handlerClass - Full qualified class name for the handler.
        Returns:
        The id of the Task.
        Throws:
        TaskAlreadyExistsException - Thrown, when there is already a task with this name.

      • addTask

        Long addTask(String uniqueTaskName,
             boolean active,
             Long interval,
             Date nextExecutionDate,
             String handlerClass)
      throws TaskAlreadyExistsException
        Add a new task.
        Parameters:
        uniqueTaskName - Unique name for this task.
        active - True, if active.
        interval - Interval for the execution.
        nextExecutionDate - The next execution date.
        handlerClass - Full qualified class name for the handler.
        Returns:
        The id of the Task.
        Throws:
        TaskAlreadyExistsException - Thrown, when there is already a task with this name.

      • addTaskHandler

        void addTaskHandler(Class<? extends TaskHandler> taskHandler)
        Add a handler for tasks. The handler will be registered under its full class name. If a handler with the same name already exists it will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        taskHandler - the task handler to add

      • addTaskHandler

        void addTaskHandler(String handlerName,
                    Class<? extends TaskHandler> taskHandler)
        Add a handler for tasks with the given name. If a handler with the same name already exists it will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        handlerName - the name of the handler to be used
        taskHandler - the task handler to add

      • addTaskHandlerWithTask

        void addTaskHandlerWithTask(String handlerName,
                            Class<? extends TaskHandler> taskHandlerClazz,
                            Map<String,String> properties,
                            long startOffset,
                            boolean resetFailed)
        Add a task handler and create a task for it. If a task already exists which has an execution time before now + startOffset, the task will be rescheduled to run with the new start time (now + startOffset).
        Parameters:
        handlerName - the name of the handler. The name will also be used as unique name for the task.
        taskHandlerClazz - the TaskHandler class
        properties - Properties for the task (if one is added).
        startOffset - the offset in milliseconds to add to the current time to delay the execution of the task
        resetFailed - if true and the status of an existing task is failed the task will be always rescheduled.

      • failTaskExecution

        void failTaskExecution(String uniqueTaskName)
                throws InvalidInstanceException
        Mark the execution of a task as failed.
        Parameters:
        uniqueTaskName - Name of the task.
        Throws:
        InvalidInstanceException - Thrown, when the task is not running on this instance.

      • findTask

        TaskTO findTask(String uniqueTaskName)
        Get the details of a task.
        Parameters:
        uniqueTaskName - The name of the task
        Returns:
        the TO containing the details of the task or null if there is no task for that name. The handler of the task won't be set

      • getNextScheduledTask

        TaskTO getNextScheduledTask()
        Return the next task to be scheduled.
        Returns:
        TaskTO or null if there is none.

      • getNextScheduledTask

        TaskTO getNextScheduledTask(Date upperBound)
        Return the next task to be scheduled.
        Parameters:
        upperBound - The upper bound of the task's next execution (exclusive).
        Returns:
        TaskTO or null if there is none.

      • getNextScheduledTasks

        Collection<TaskTO> getNextScheduledTasks(Date upperBound,
                                         int maxTasks,
                                         Collection<Long> taskIdsToExclude)
        Get the tasks to schedule next
        Parameters:
        upperBound - NextExecution < UpperBound.
        maxTasks - maximum number of tasks to return
        taskIdsToExclude - the IDs of the task to exclude from the query. Can be null.
        Returns:
        List all tasks, which can be executed.

      • getTaskExecutions

        Collection<TaskExecution> getTaskExecutions(String instanceName)
        Return all task executions running on the Communote with the given name.
        Parameters:
        instanceName - Name of the instance
        Returns:
        List of task executions of the instance

      • isTaskRunningOnCurrentInstance

        boolean isTaskRunningOnCurrentInstance(String uniqueTaskName)
        Return whether the given task is running on the current instance.
        Parameters:
        uniqueTaskName - the unique name of the task
        Returns:
        true if the task is running on the current instance, false otherwise

      • killTaskExecution

        String killTaskExecution(Long executionId)
        Kill the task with given execution ID by removing the execution and setting the task back to pending.
        Parameters:
        executionId - The execution ID
        Returns:
        The unique name of the task, which was killed, or null if there was none.

      • removeTask

        void removeTask(String uniqueTaskName)
         throws TaskAlreadyRunningException
        Remove a task if it is not RUNNING.
        Parameters:
        uniqueTaskName - The task to remove.
        Throws:
        TaskAlreadyRunningException - Thrown, when the task is currently running.

      • removeTaskHandler

        boolean removeTaskHandler(String handlerName)
        Remove the task handler class from the list of known handlers.
        Parameters:
        handlerName - the handler name
        Returns:
        true if something has actually been removed

      • rescheduleTask

        void rescheduleTask(String uniqueTaskName,
                    Date nextExecutionDate)
             throws TaskStatusException
        Reschedule a pending task.
        Parameters:
        uniqueTaskName - the unique name of task. If there is no task with the given name the call will be ignored.
        nextExecutionDate - the new execution date
        Throws:
        TaskStatusException - in case the task is not pending

      • resetTask

        void resetTask(String uniqueTaskName)
        Reset a task back from failed to pending. Also removes an existing execution.
        Parameters:
        uniqueTaskName - The name of the task to reset

      • startTaskExecution

        Long startTaskExecution(String uniqueTaskName)
                 throws TaskAlreadyRunningException,
                        TaskNotActiveException,
                        TaskManagementException
        Mark a task as running on this instance by creating an execution for it and setting the status to RUNNING. This call is ignored if the next execution timestamp of the task is in the future.
        Parameters:
        uniqueTaskName - Name of the task to start.
        Returns:
        the ID of the created execution or null if the task does not exist or next execution timestamp is in the future
        Throws:
        TaskAlreadyRunningException - in case the task is already running.
        TaskNotActiveException - in case the task is not activated.
        TaskManagementException - in case of an unexpected error

      • startTaskExecutionTx

        Long startTaskExecutionTx(String uniqueTaskName)
                   throws TaskNotActiveException,
                          TaskAlreadyRunningException
        Same as startTaskExecution(String) but can throw DatabaseIntegrityViolationException. Therefore this method should never be called directly and startTaskExecution(String) should be used instead.
        Parameters:
        uniqueTaskName - Name of the task to start.
        Returns:
        the ID of the created execution or null if the task does not exist or next execution timestamp is in the future
        Throws:
        TaskAlreadyRunningException - in case the task is already running.
        TaskNotActiveException - In case if the task is not activated.

      • stopAllTaskExecutions

        void stopAllTaskExecutions()
        Calls stopAllTaskExecutions(true,now).

      • stopAllTaskExecutions

        void stopAllTaskExecutions(boolean resetFailed,
                           Date rescheduleDate)
        End all task executions of this instance and schedules them again.
        Parameters:
        rescheduleDate - If set, this will be the new date the task will be executed.
        resetFailed - If set, all failed tasks will be reset.

      • stopTaskExecution

        void stopTaskExecution(String uniqueTaskName)
                throws InvalidInstanceException
        End the execution of the given task.
        Parameters:
        uniqueTaskName - Name of the task.
        Throws:
        InvalidInstanceException - in case the task is not executed on this instance

      • stopTaskExecution

        void stopTaskExecution(String uniqueTaskName,
                       Date rescheduleDate)
                throws InvalidInstanceException
        End the execution of the given task.
        Parameters:
        uniqueTaskName - Unique name of the task.
        rescheduleDate - If set, this will be the new date the task will be executed.
        Throws:
        InvalidInstanceException - in case the task is not running on this instance
